greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(m,n) = number of different lines in a rectangular m X n array of points with integer coordinates (x,y): 0 <= x <= m, 0 <= y <= n.
comment: We may assume n <= m since T(m,n)=T(n,m).
link: M. A. Alekseyev, M. Basova, N. Yu. Zolotykh. On the minimal teaching sets of two-dimensional threshold functions. SIAM J. Disc. Math. 29(1), 2015, pp. 157-165.
Les Reid, Problem #7: How Many Lines Does the Lattice of Points Generate?, Problems from the 04-05 academic year, Challenge Archive, Missouri State University's Problem Corner
formula: When both m,n -> +oo, T(m,n) / 2Cmn -> 9/(2*pi^2). - _Dan Dima_, Mar 18 2006
maple: for i from -m+1 to m-1 do for j from -n+1 to n-1 do
if gcd(i,j)=q then a:=a+(m-abs(i))*(n-abs(j)); fi; od: od: a; end;
for m from 1 to 12 do lprint([seq(LL(m,n),n=1..m)]); od: # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 10 2020
xref: Cf. A295707 (symmetric array), A018808 (diagonal). A160842 - A160850 (columns).
results.author: _Dan Dima_, May 23 2005
ext: T(3,3) corrected and sequence extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 17 2017
